issue.title: Page feedback shouldn't require that a Google Analytics ID be set as a config parameter

labels.name: e0-minutes
labels.description: Effort < 60 min

issue.body:
Google Analytics isn't always enabled via Docsy config -- for example, see:

- https://github.com/open-policy-agent/opa/issues/5384 and 
- https://github.com/prometheus/docs/issues/2181

For such projects, that want to use the [page-feedback feature], they should be able to `enable` page-feedback without having to supply a bogus analytics ID. WDYT @LisaFC @emckean @geriom?

[page-feedback feature]: https://www.docsy.dev/docs/adding-content/feedback/#user-feedback

comment.body: There are a number of advantages, which I hope to share here (or during the next PSC meeting I"m able to attend) soon.

Hello 

I am from Minikube team and per conversation with @jimangel I am creating this issue, to request adding Google analytics to minikube website https://minikube.sigs.k8s.io/ (similar to what Kubernetes website has)

I would like to start this request and would like to know what is the next step, and do we create our own Google analytics account or share with Kubernetes Website?

issue.title: Enable Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
issue.body:
As discussed elsewhere (https://cncfservicedesk.atlassian.net/browse/CNCFSD-1458), the plan is to enable GA4 by using the existing GA4 Envoy web data stream with ID `G-DXJEH1ZRXX`.

For some context, the main repo was migrated to GA4 via:

- https://github.com/envoyproxy/envoy-website/issues/273

Let's use this issue to discuss implementation details.

Tasks:

- [x] Add GA4 ID to main site pages (that is, non-doc pages)
    https://github.com/envoy-mobile/envoy-mobile.github.io/pull/27
- [x] #2681

comment.body:
Here is what I used on another project:

```text
sphinxcontrib-googleanalytics @ git+https://github.com/sphinx-contrib/googleanalytics.git@42b3df99fdc01a136b9c575f3f251ae80cdfbe1d
```

commits.message:
hive: Show actual parsed config in PrintObjects()

Before the config objects shown in PrintObjects showed the defaults by iterating
over the registered flags:

    $ ./cilium-agent objects --k8s-api-server foobar

    ⚙️ client.Config:
      • enable-k8s-api-discovery[bool]  = false
      • k8s-api-server[string]          =
      • k8s-client-burst[int]           = 0
      • k8s-client-qps[float32]         = 0
      • k8s-heartbeat-timeout[duration] = 30s
      • k8s-kubeconfig-path[string]     =

Above you can see that the "k8s-api-server" flag did not reflect what was provided on
command-line

This commit changes the config info to pull the parsed configuration from the dig
container and show that using the spew package:

    ⚙️ (client.Config) {
      K8sAPIServer: (string) (len=6) "foobar",
      K8sKubeConfigPath: (string) "",
      K8sClientQPS: (float32) 0,
      K8sClientBurst: (int) 0,
      K8sHeartbeatTimeout: (time.Duration) 30s,
      EnableK8sAPIDiscovery: (bool) false
    }

Signed-off-by: Jussi Maki <jussi@isovalent.com>

hive: Unwrap provider inputs and outputs in PrintObjects

Previously the provider function type was shown in PrintObjects:


  🚧 pkg/node.newLocalNodeStore (local_node_store.go:71): func(node.LocalNodeStoreParams) (node.LocalNodeStore, error)

This does not unwrap the param and result structs and thus does
not give enough information about the constructor. This commit fixes
the issue by using dig.FillProviderInfo to pull the constructors
actual inputs and outputs:

  🚧 pkg/node.newLocalNodeStore (local_node_store.go:71):
    ⮩ hive.Lifecycle, node.LocalNodeInitializer[optional]
    ⮨ node.LocalNodeStore

Signed-off-by: Jussi Maki <jussi@isovalent.com>

hive: Clean up breaks in PrintObjects

This removes AddBreak and does the more obvious right thing and prints the
separating newline in InfoNode.Print().

Fixes the "double breaks" after nested modules.

Signed-off-by: Jussi Maki <jussi@isovalent.com>

hive: Detect terminal width for use in InfoLeaf line wrapping

Detect the width with term.GetSize() instead of using a hard-coded width
for wrapping the list of input and output objects.

Signed-off-by: Jussi Maki <jussi@isovalent.com>

hive: Fix printing of hook function names

We need to have special handling for printing the start and stop hook
names if the hook is not the "Hook" struct.

To keep things simple just print the type name + method instead of
going via FuncForPC. This makes sure we show reasonable output for
polymorphic structs as well (which would not have file+line or the
type params if FuncForPC was used).

Log output before:
level=info msg="Start hook executed" duration="1.853µs" function="node.newLocalNodeStore.func1 (local_node_store.go:80)" subsys=hive
level=info msg="Start hook executed" duration="5.681µs" function="hive.Hook.Start-fm (<autogenerated>:1)" subsys=hive

Log output after:
level=info msg="Start hook executed" duration=992ns function="node.newLocalNodeStore.func1 (local_node_store.go:80)" subsys=hive
level=info msg="Start hook executed" duration="4.939µs" function="*resource.resource[*k8s.io/api/core/v1.Node].Start" subsys=hive

Signed-off-by: Jussi Maki <jussi@isovalent.com>

.github/workflows: remove parallelization in image base builds

Since the builder image depends on the runtime image we should remove
the parallelization of those builds and make them sequential instead.

Signed-off-by: André Martins <andre@cilium.io>

add auto-commit capability to build base images GH workflow

This commit adds the ability to have automatic commits being pushed for
the base images github workflow. This simplifies the build process of the
base images as it will no longer require developers to wait and re-push
changes.

Resume of the changes:
- Re-write documentation with the new process
- Moved scripts to update tags in the git tree to the respective
  directories of the images. This is to prevent accidental or malicious
  changes by third-parties in the script files that could compromise the
  build process. If the files are modified, it will require an approval
  from the cilium/build team before the GH action is executed.
- Changed CODEOWNERS file to request for a review from the
  cilium/github-sec team as the scripts are directly used in the GH
  workflow.
- For future reference, this GH auto-committer workflow is using a token
  created by the machine-learning-apps/actions-app-token GH action and
  that GH action is using the auto-committer app [1] created exclusively
  for this purpose.

[1] https://github.com/organizations/cilium/settings/apps/auto-committer/permissions

Signed-off-by: André Martins <andre@cilium.io>

images: update cilium-{runtime,builder}

Signed-off-by: GH action <ghabot@does.not.exist.cilium.org>

k8s/client: respect QPS and burst setting for clientset

When constructing a new clientset, the provided QPS and burst values are
currently not considered.

Fixes: 00e40bb41683 ("k8s: Drop k8s.Init and k8s.Configure")

Signed-off-by: Tobias Klauser <tobias@cilium.io>

policy: replace RWMutex with Mutex

This is only locked using write locks, so replacing it with a normal
mutex would reduce the overhead by a tiny bit.

This could probably see a lot of improvements by rewriting to a proper
rwmutex and use read locking, but I think we should have some kind of
benchmark to ensure that change would be net positive; and I think
this commit is a positive step towards that.

Signed-off-by: Odin Ugedal <ougedal@palantir.com>

docs: Shuffle some conf.py variables, format pep8

Apply some pep8 styling changes, and move the language declaration above
the extlinks declaration. An upcoming commit will reuse the language
value from extlinks, so by moving it up we can avoid moving that code in
the later functional commit.

No functional changes intended in this commit.

Signed-off-by: Joe Stringer <joe@cilium.io>

docs: Remove 1.12 and earlier upgrade docs

These docs are already stored in the v1.12 branch and exposed via the
corresponding docs on docs.cilium.io, so there is no need to include
that text directly in the page. Removing it will also help developers to
update the correct notes for the upcoming release.

With a bit of conf.py trickery, we can even achieve this without
hardcoding a number that we have to update each time there's a new
release.

Signed-off-by: Joe Stringer <joe@cilium.io>

build(deps): bump sphinxcontrib-spelling

issue.title: Migrate relnotes.k8s.io to Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
issue.body:
This issue is part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4 since **Google has deprecated Universal Analytics** (UA). For more details, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to a suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Prerequisite

There is still an open discussion about which GA4 property to use. Currently the main thread is here: https://github.com/kubernetes/website/issues/37801#issuecomment-1319363201.

### Tasks

- [ ] Decide which GA4 property & measurement ID to use (see prerequisites above).
- [ ] Link UA ID from GA4 ID
- [ ] Update code to use GA4 ID:
    https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/release-notes/blob/fdfadb05eed19435097c048be21afe528eba97f4/src/index.html#L12
- [ ] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events
- [ ] Confirm that the UA site tag is still receiving events

### Notes

- Corresponding issue for main site:
  https://github.com/kubernetes/website/issues/35299

### Pre-migration website analytics info

- UA ID: `UA-98841695-4` ([analytics console](https://analytics.google.com/analytics/web/?pli=1#/report-home/a98841695w204594590p197952062))
- Website is an Angular single-page app

/cc @caniszczyk @nate-double-u @a-mccarthy

issue.body:
Hello 

I am from Minikube team and per conversation with @jimangel I am creating this issue, to request adding Google analytics to minikube website https://minikube.sigs.k8s.io/ (similar to what Kubernetes website has)

I would like to start this request and would like to know what is the next step, and do we create our own Google analytics account or share with Kubernetes Website?

comment.body:
@a-mccarthy: thanks for your response. Actually, "Example B" in the [Google Analytics 4 account structure](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9679158) page suggests a single property for all websites, and in fact, a single web stream for all websites (so that, e.g., we can configure cross-domain tracking).

For a list of k8s websites (at least those that I currently know about), see rows 2 - 12 of the [CNCF project GA4 migration status](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA). 

> You've raised questions about what sites should be connected to the Kubernetes analytics account before, and i'm note sure if there was a final answer there. 

Yes, that is the main question to be answered, and the one that will impact how we choose to setup the GA4 account. As you proposed elsewhere, maybe we should meet to discuss this.

> But this feels like something we should decide on and keep track of somewhere. Hopefully we can write down the criteria and process for getting added so folks know how to ask for this in the future.

Agreed.

issue.title: Rename Netlify preview-only host or host docs via Netlify
issue.body:
_Originally posted by @michi-covalent in https://github.com/cilium/cilium.io/issues/164#issuecomment-1315577841_

> - Docs have two hosts: I'd like some insights as to why there seem to be two hosting services active for the docs.
> 
> https://docs.cilium.io is currently using [readthedocs](https://readthedocs.org/) to host the production site. we use cncf netlify account for deploy previews. https://docs-cilium-io.netlify.app comes from that. not sure if there is a way to disable *.netlify.app domain.

The current situation is a bit confusing. Two options come to mind:

1. Consider **renaming** the Netlify preview-only **host** to contain "preview" in the name. That makes it clear that the hosting service is used for previews only (I know of at least one other CNCF project that has done this).
2. Consider actually hosting the production site and docs via Netlify. ~I seem to recall a CNCF project that had done this, but I might be confusing this with Mkdocs. I'll have to double check and get back to you.~ See next comment for details.

Thoughts @michi-covalent @lizrice @xmulligan @qmonnet

comment.body:
Not urgent. 23Q1 seems fine.

Another option would be to use Netlify snippet injection to add a banner to the preview-only site so that folks who land on it know that it is preview-only. With that in place, it might be unnecessary to rename the Netlify host.

issue.title: Migrate to Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
issue.body:
This is part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4 since **Google has deprecated Universal Analytics** (UA). For more details, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to:
  - A suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), 
  which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Tasks

- [x] Create a GA4 site tag under the **CNCF projects** account.
  The new GA4 stream measurement ID is: **`G-93T2VC0VBC`**
- [x] Main website - `UA-82811140-41`:
  - [x] [Connect] UA site tag from the GA4 site tag.
  - [x] Use [gtag.js] library to register GA4 ID - #241
  - [x] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events
  - [x] Confirm that the UA site tag, `UA-82811140-41`, is receiving events
- [ ] [docs.fluentd.org](https://docs.fluentd.org/) - `UA-181341719-4`, which CNCF doesn't currently have access to.
    https://github.com/fluent/fluentd-docs-gitbook/issues/437
  - [ ] [Connect] UA site tag from the GA4 site tag.
  - [ ] Use [gtag.js] library to register GA4 ID
- [ ] [docs.fluentbit.io](https://docs.fluentbit.io/) - `UA-181341719-3`, which CNCF doesn't currently have access to
  - [ ] [Connect] UA site tag from the GA4 site tag.
  - [ ] Use [gtag.js] library to register GA4 ID

### Later

- Cleanup: there are still traces in the main site pages of the old GTM ID. Those scripts should be removed.

/cc @nate-double-u @caniszczyk @fujimotos 

---

Related, background & prep-work:

- #100: apparently TD used `GTM-T7BJ3X` and the CNCF used `GTM-TFCP8WJ` though there is no trace of such a GTM ID at the CNCF.
- #234

issue.title: Migrate to Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
issue.body:
**Google has deprecated Universal Analytics** (UA), in favor of its successor, Google Analytics 4 (GA4). This issue is part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4. For more details about the deprecation and the CNCF migration effort, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to a suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Tasks: stages 1 & 2

- [x] Create a GA4 site tag under the **CNCF projects** account.
  The new GA4 stream measurement ID is: **`G-V9SYWYG92Y`**
- [x] Enable GA4 site tag, ideally via [Netlify snippet injection] (leaving the GTM site tag in place), "Google Analytics 4 - only in production", just before `</head>`:
  ```liquid
  {% if CONTEXT == 'production' %}
  <script async src="https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtag/js?id=G-V9SYWYG92Y"></script>
  <script>
    window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];
    function gtag(){dataLayer.push(arguments);}
    gtag('js', new Date());
  
    gtag('config', 'G-V9SYWYG92Y');
  </script>
  {% endif %}
  ```
- [x] Ensure that the GA4 site tag is receiving events.
- [x] I'm going to assume that the GTM tag is still processing events, since the registration code hasn't been touched. If someone with access to that Analytics account can confirm, that would be appreciated.

### Tasks: followup

- Eventually, the GTM tag will stop working. Either it will need to be upgraded, or simply dropped in favor of the GA4 site tag. #194

### Sites

- **Main site**: this issue is for the main site, [cilium.io](https://cilium.io/), which is currently setup with a Google Tag Manager (GTM) tag, `GTM-M533ZSF`.
- **Docs**: I'll be creating a separate issue for the `docs` subdomain, which is built from [cilium/cilium](https://github.com/cilium/cilium). This docs issue is:
  https://github.com/cilium/cilium/issues/22007

/cc @caniszczyk @nate-double-u

[Netlify snippet injection]: https://docs.netlify.com/site-deploys/post-processing/snippet-injection/

I've created a separate issue to track this, see:

- #195

issue.title: Add textlint tooling
issue.body:
After playing around with vale.sh for some time, I figured out that textlint might be the better tool for us, since it's config neatly fits into the package.json, so we don't need to add a huge list of additional files. Also there's some capability for "auto-fixing" which is nice if used in the visual code UI.

I still want to build this incrementally, so instead of pulling in a HUGE set of rules I wrote some terminology settings from scratch, mainly following the [CNCF style guide](https://github.com/cncf/foundation/blob/main/style-guide.md), e.g. "open-source" vs "open source" or "K8s" vs "K8S" and the suggested check how CNCF projects prefer their naming (gRPC vs grpc vs GRPC).

There's two issues right now with textlint:
* ~~A bug that it does not catch wrong use of terms at the end of the line (will raise an issue for that with the project)~~ now it works 🤷 
* It works well with markdown but has issues again with hugo 

Additionally I added a cspell.json, so instead of having each and every word ignored in the file we can maintain a global set of words.

comment.body: Yeah, I was on the fence for tabpane, but it feels ok for it to stay in the global file.

This issue is part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4 since **Google has deprecated Universal Analytics** (UA). For more details, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to a suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Tasks

- [ ] [Connect] the UA ID `UA-98841695-3` from the [GA4 web data stream `G-JPP6RFM2BP`][ga4-web]
- [x] From the [UA console], filter out all events not from `discuss.kubernetes.io`
- [ ] Configure the Discourse server to use the GA4 ID `G-JPP6RFM2BP`
- [ ] Confirm that the GA4 data stream is receiving events from the discuss server
- [ ] Confirm that the UA site tag is still receiving events

### Notes

- Corresponding issue for main site: https://github.com/kubernetes/website/issues/35299
- Followup: Drop dis[connect] the UA ID once it is no longer needed
- I'm not sure that this is the right repo to create this issue in, but it seemed like the most reasonable choice. If the issue needs to be moved, please let me know.

pull_request.body:
After playing around with vale.sh for some time, I figured out that textlint might be the better tool for us, since it's config neatly fits into the package.json, so we don't need to add a huge list of additional files. Also there's some capability for "auto-fixing" which is nice if used in the visual code UI.

I still want to build this incrementally, so instead of pulling in a HUGE set of rules I wrote some terminology settings from scratch, mainly following the [CNCF style guide](https://github.com/cncf/foundation/blob/main/style-guide.md), e.g. "open-source" vs "open source" or "K8s" vs "K8S" and the suggested check how CNCF projects prefer their naming (gRPC vs grpc vs GRPC).

There's two issues right now with textlint:
* A bug that it does not catch wrong use of terms at the end of the line (will raise an issue for that with the project)
* It works well with markdown but has issues again with hugo 

Additionally I added a cspell.json, so instead of having each and every word ignored in the file we can maintain a global set of words.

pull_request.title: Text and style fixes for concept pages
pull_request.body: Mainly applying CNCF guidelines for "open source": https://github.com/cncf/foundation/blob/main/style-guide.md

issue.title: Page feedback shouldn't require that a Google Analytics ID be set as a config parameter

labels.name: e0-minutes
labels.description: Effort < 60 min

issue.body:
Google Analytics isn't always enabled via Docsy config -- for example, see:

- https://github.com/open-policy-agent/opa/issues/5384 and 
- https://github.com/prometheus/docs/issues/2181

For such projects, that want to use the [page-feedback feature], they should be able to `enable` page-feedback without having to supply a bogus analytics ID. WDYT @LisaFC @emckean @geriom?

[page-feedback feature]: https://www.docsy.dev/docs/adding-content/feedback/#user-feedback

comment.body: There are a number of advantages, which I hope to share here (or during the next PSC meeting I"m able to attend) soon.

issue.title: Enable Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
issue.body:
As discussed elsewhere (https://cncfservicedesk.atlassian.net/browse/CNCFSD-1458), the plan is to enable GA4 by using the existing GA4 Envoy web data stream with ID `G-DXJEH1ZRXX`.

For some context, the main repo was migrated to GA4 via:

- https://github.com/envoyproxy/envoy-website/issues/273

Let's use this issue to discuss implementation details.

Tasks:

- [x] Add GA4 ID to main site pages (that is, non-doc pages)
    https://github.com/envoy-mobile/envoy-mobile.github.io/pull/27
- [x] #2681

commits.message:
hive: Show actual parsed config in PrintObjects()

Before the config objects shown in PrintObjects showed the defaults by iterating
over the registered flags:

    $ ./cilium-agent objects --k8s-api-server foobar

    ⚙️ client.Config:
      • enable-k8s-api-discovery[bool]  = false
      • k8s-api-server[string]          =
      • k8s-client-burst[int]           = 0
      • k8s-client-qps[float32]         = 0
      • k8s-heartbeat-timeout[duration] = 30s
      • k8s-kubeconfig-path[string]     =

Above you can see that the "k8s-api-server" flag did not reflect what was provided on
command-line

This commit changes the config info to pull the parsed configuration from the dig
container and show that using the spew package:

    ⚙️ (client.Config) {
      K8sAPIServer: (string) (len=6) "foobar",
      K8sKubeConfigPath: (string) "",
      K8sClientQPS: (float32) 0,
      K8sClientBurst: (int) 0,
      K8sHeartbeatTimeout: (time.Duration) 30s,
      EnableK8sAPIDiscovery: (bool) false
    }

Signed-off-by: Jussi Maki <jussi@isovalent.com>

hive: Unwrap provider inputs and outputs in PrintObjects

Previously the provider function type was shown in PrintObjects:


  🚧 pkg/node.newLocalNodeStore (local_node_store.go:71): func(node.LocalNodeStoreParams) (node.LocalNodeStore, error)

This does not unwrap the param and result structs and thus does
not give enough information about the constructor. This commit fixes
the issue by using dig.FillProviderInfo to pull the constructors
actual inputs and outputs:

  🚧 pkg/node.newLocalNodeStore (local_node_store.go:71):
    ⮩ hive.Lifecycle, node.LocalNodeInitializer[optional]
    ⮨ node.LocalNodeStore

Signed-off-by: Jussi Maki <jussi@isovalent.com>

hive: Clean up breaks in PrintObjects

This removes AddBreak and does the more obvious right thing and prints the
separating newline in InfoNode.Print().

Fixes the "double breaks" after nested modules.

Signed-off-by: Jussi Maki <jussi@isovalent.com>

hive: Detect terminal width for use in InfoLeaf line wrapping

Detect the width with term.GetSize() instead of using a hard-coded width
for wrapping the list of input and output objects.

Signed-off-by: Jussi Maki <jussi@isovalent.com>

hive: Fix printing of hook function names

We need to have special handling for printing the start and stop hook
names if the hook is not the "Hook" struct.

To keep things simple just print the type name + method instead of
going via FuncForPC. This makes sure we show reasonable output for
polymorphic structs as well (which would not have file+line or the
type params if FuncForPC was used).

Log output before:
level=info msg="Start hook executed" duration="1.853µs" function="node.newLocalNodeStore.func1 (local_node_store.go:80)" subsys=hive
level=info msg="Start hook executed" duration="5.681µs" function="hive.Hook.Start-fm (<autogenerated>:1)" subsys=hive

Log output after:
level=info msg="Start hook executed" duration=992ns function="node.newLocalNodeStore.func1 (local_node_store.go:80)" subsys=hive
level=info msg="Start hook executed" duration="4.939µs" function="*resource.resource[*k8s.io/api/core/v1.Node].Start" subsys=hive

Signed-off-by: Jussi Maki <jussi@isovalent.com>

.github/workflows: remove parallelization in image base builds

Since the builder image depends on the runtime image we should remove
the parallelization of those builds and make them sequential instead.

Signed-off-by: André Martins <andre@cilium.io>

add auto-commit capability to build base images GH workflow

This commit adds the ability to have automatic commits being pushed for
the base images github workflow. This simplifies the build process of the
base images as it will no longer require developers to wait and re-push
changes.

Resume of the changes:
- Re-write documentation with the new process
- Moved scripts to update tags in the git tree to the respective
  directories of the images. This is to prevent accidental or malicious
  changes by third-parties in the script files that could compromise the
  build process. If the files are modified, it will require an approval
  from the cilium/build team before the GH action is executed.
- Changed CODEOWNERS file to request for a review from the
  cilium/github-sec team as the scripts are directly used in the GH
  workflow.
- For future reference, this GH auto-committer workflow is using a token
  created by the machine-learning-apps/actions-app-token GH action and
  that GH action is using the auto-committer app [1] created exclusively
  for this purpose.

[1] https://github.com/organizations/cilium/settings/apps/auto-committer/permissions

Signed-off-by: André Martins <andre@cilium.io>

k8s/client: respect QPS and burst setting for clientset

When constructing a new clientset, the provided QPS and burst values are
currently not considered.

Fixes: 00e40bb41683 ("k8s: Drop k8s.Init and k8s.Configure")

Signed-off-by: Tobias Klauser <tobias@cilium.io>

policy: replace RWMutex with Mutex

This is only locked using write locks, so replacing it with a normal
mutex would reduce the overhead by a tiny bit.

This could probably see a lot of improvements by rewriting to a proper
rwmutex and use read locking, but I think we should have some kind of
benchmark to ensure that change would be net positive; and I think
this commit is a positive step towards that.

Signed-off-by: Odin Ugedal <ougedal@palantir.com>

docs: Shuffle some conf.py variables, format pep8

Apply some pep8 styling changes, and move the language declaration above
the extlinks declaration. An upcoming commit will reuse the language
value from extlinks, so by moving it up we can avoid moving that code in
the later functional commit.

No functional changes intended in this commit.

Signed-off-by: Joe Stringer <joe@cilium.io>

docs: Remove 1.12 and earlier upgrade docs

These docs are already stored in the v1.12 branch and exposed via the
corresponding docs on docs.cilium.io, so there is no need to include
that text directly in the page. Removing it will also help developers to
update the correct notes for the upcoming release.

With a bit of conf.py trickery, we can even achieve this without
hardcoding a number that we have to update each time there's a new
release.

Signed-off-by: Joe Stringer <joe@cilium.io>

issue.title: Migrate relnotes.k8s.io to Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
issue.body:
This issue is part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4 since **Google has deprecated Universal Analytics** (UA). For more details, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to a suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Prerequisite

There is still an open discussion about which GA4 property to use. Currently the main thread is here: https://github.com/kubernetes/website/issues/37801#issuecomment-1319363201.

### Tasks

- [ ] Decide which GA4 property & measurement ID to use (see prerequisites above).
- [ ] Link UA ID from GA4 ID
- [ ] Update code to use GA4 ID:
    https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/release-notes/blob/fdfadb05eed19435097c048be21afe528eba97f4/src/index.html#L12
- [ ] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events
- [ ] Confirm that the UA site tag is still receiving events

### Notes

- Corresponding issue for main site:
  https://github.com/kubernetes/website/issues/35299

### Pre-migration website analytics info

- UA ID: `UA-98841695-4` ([analytics console](https://analytics.google.com/analytics/web/?pli=1#/report-home/a98841695w204594590p197952062))
- Website is an Angular single-page app

/cc @caniszczyk @nate-double-u @a-mccarthy

issue.body:
Hello 

I am from Minikube team and per conversation with @jimangel I am creating this issue, to request adding Google analytics to minikube website https://minikube.sigs.k8s.io/ (similar to what Kubernetes website has)

I would like to start this request and would like to know what is the next step, and do we create our own Google analytics account or share with Kubernetes Website?

comment.body:
@a-mccarthy: thanks for your response. Actually, "Example B" in the [Google Analytics 4 account structure](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9679158) page suggests a single property for all websites, and in fact, a single web stream for all websites (so that, e.g., we can configure cross-domain tracking).

For a list of k8s websites (at least those that I currently know about), see rows 2 - 12 of the [CNCF project GA4 migration status](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA). 

> You've raised questions about what sites should be connected to the Kubernetes analytics account before, and i'm note sure if there was a final answer there. 

Yes, that is the main question to be answered, and the one that will impact how we choose to setup the GA4 account. As you proposed elsewhere, maybe we should meet to discuss this.

> But this feels like something we should decide on and keep track of somewhere. Hopefully we can write down the criteria and process for getting added so folks know how to ask for this in the future.

Agreed.

issue.title: Rename Netlify preview-only host or host docs via Netlify
issue.body:
_Originally posted by @michi-covalent in https://github.com/cilium/cilium.io/issues/164#issuecomment-1315577841_

> - Docs have two hosts: I'd like some insights as to why there seem to be two hosting services active for the docs.
> 
> https://docs.cilium.io is currently using [readthedocs](https://readthedocs.org/) to host the production site. we use cncf netlify account for deploy previews. https://docs-cilium-io.netlify.app comes from that. not sure if there is a way to disable *.netlify.app domain.

The current situation is a bit confusing. Two options come to mind:

1. Consider **renaming** the Netlify preview-only **host** to contain "preview" in the name. That makes it clear that the hosting service is used for previews only (I know of at least one other CNCF project that has done this).
2. Consider actually hosting the production site and docs via Netlify. ~I seem to recall a CNCF project that had done this, but I might be confusing this with Mkdocs. I'll have to double check and get back to you.~ See next comment for details.

Thoughts @michi-covalent @lizrice @xmulligan @qmonnet

comment.body:
Not urgent. 23Q1 seems fine.

Another option would be to use Netlify snippet injection to add a banner to the preview-only site so that folks who land on it know that it is preview-only. With that in place, it might be unnecessary to rename the Netlify host.

issue.title: Migrate to Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
issue.body:
This is part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4 since **Google has deprecated Universal Analytics** (UA). For more details, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to:
  - A suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), 
  which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Tasks

- [x] Create a GA4 site tag under the **CNCF projects** account.
  The new GA4 stream measurement ID is: **`G-93T2VC0VBC`**
- [x] Main website - `UA-82811140-41`:
  - [x] [Connect] UA site tag from the GA4 site tag.
  - [x] Use [gtag.js] library to register GA4 ID - #241
  - [x] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events
  - [x] Confirm that the UA site tag, `UA-82811140-41`, is receiving events
- [ ] [docs.fluentd.org](https://docs.fluentd.org/) - `UA-181341719-4`, which CNCF doesn't currently have access to.
    https://github.com/fluent/fluentd-docs-gitbook/issues/437
  - [ ] [Connect] UA site tag from the GA4 site tag.
  - [ ] Use [gtag.js] library to register GA4 ID
- [ ] [docs.fluentbit.io](https://docs.fluentbit.io/) - `UA-181341719-3`, which CNCF doesn't currently have access to
  - [ ] [Connect] UA site tag from the GA4 site tag.
  - [ ] Use [gtag.js] library to register GA4 ID

### Later

- Cleanup: there are still traces in the main site pages of the old GTM ID. Those scripts should be removed.

/cc @nate-double-u @caniszczyk @fujimotos 

---

Related, background & prep-work:

- #100: apparently TD used `GTM-T7BJ3X` and the CNCF used `GTM-TFCP8WJ` though there is no trace of such a GTM ID at the CNCF.
- #234

issue.title: Migrate to Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
issue.body:
**Google has deprecated Universal Analytics** (UA), in favor of its successor, Google Analytics 4 (GA4). This issue is part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4. For more details about the deprecation and the CNCF migration effort, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to a suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Tasks: stages 1 & 2

- [x] Create a GA4 site tag under the **CNCF projects** account.
  The new GA4 stream measurement ID is: **`G-V9SYWYG92Y`**
- [x] Enable GA4 site tag, ideally via [Netlify snippet injection] (leaving the GTM site tag in place), "Google Analytics 4 - only in production", just before `</head>`:
  ```liquid
  {% if CONTEXT == 'production' %}
  <script async src="https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtag/js?id=G-V9SYWYG92Y"></script>
  <script>
    window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];
    function gtag(){dataLayer.push(arguments);}
    gtag('js', new Date());
  
    gtag('config', 'G-V9SYWYG92Y');
  </script>
  {% endif %}
  ```
- [x] Ensure that the GA4 site tag is receiving events.
- [x] I'm going to assume that the GTM tag is still processing events, since the registration code hasn't been touched. If someone with access to that Analytics account can confirm, that would be appreciated.

### Tasks: followup

- Eventually, the GTM tag will stop working. Either it will need to be upgraded, or simply dropped in favor of the GA4 site tag. #194

### Sites

- **Main site**: this issue is for the main site, [cilium.io](https://cilium.io/), which is currently setup with a Google Tag Manager (GTM) tag, `GTM-M533ZSF`.
- **Docs**: I'll be creating a separate issue for the `docs` subdomain, which is built from [cilium/cilium](https://github.com/cilium/cilium). This docs issue is:
  https://github.com/cilium/cilium/issues/22007

/cc @caniszczyk @nate-double-u

[Netlify snippet injection]: https://docs.netlify.com/site-deploys/post-processing/snippet-injection/

comment.body:
> https://docs.cilium.io is currently using [readthedocs](https://readthedocs.org/) to host the production site. we use cncf netlify account for deploy previews. https://docs-cilium-io.netlify.app comes from that. not sure if there is a way to disable *.netlify.app domain.

I've created a separate issue to track this, see:

- #195

hi @chalin ! 👋

we are in the process of migrating https://cilium.io site from a private netlify account to cncf account. i'll let you know when the migration is complete.

- Docs have two hosts: I'd like some insights as to why there seem to be two hosting services active for the docs.

https://docs.cilium.io is currently using [readthedocs](https://readthedocs.org/) to host the production site. we use cncf netlify account for deploy previews. https://docs-cilium-io.netlify.app comes from that. not sure if there is a way to disable *.netlify.app domain.

issue.title: Add textlint tooling
issue.body:
After playing around with vale.sh for some time, I figured out that textlint might be the better tool for us, since it's config neatly fits into the package.json, so we don't need to add a huge list of additional files. Also there's some capability for "auto-fixing" which is nice if used in the visual code UI.

I still want to build this incrementally, so instead of pulling in a HUGE set of rules I wrote some terminology settings from scratch, mainly following the [CNCF style guide](https://github.com/cncf/foundation/blob/main/style-guide.md), e.g. "open-source" vs "open source" or "K8s" vs "K8S" and the suggested check how CNCF projects prefer their naming (gRPC vs grpc vs GRPC).

There's two issues right now with textlint:
* ~~A bug that it does not catch wrong use of terms at the end of the line (will raise an issue for that with the project)~~ now it works 🤷 
* It works well with markdown but has issues again with hugo 

Additionally I added a cspell.json, so instead of having each and every word ignored in the file we can maintain a global set of words.

comment.body: Yeah, I was on the fence for tabpane, but it feels ok for it to stay in the global file.

pull_request.title: Add textlint tooling
pull_request.body:
After playing around with vale.sh for some time, I figured out that textlint might be the better tool for us, since it's config neatly fits into the package.json, so we don't need to add a huge list of additional files. Also there's some capability for "auto-fixing" which is nice if used in the visual code UI.

I still want to build this incrementally, so instead of pulling in a HUGE set of rules I wrote some terminology settings from scratch, mainly following the [CNCF style guide](https://github.com/cncf/foundation/blob/main/style-guide.md), e.g. "open-source" vs "open source" or "K8s" vs "K8S" and the suggested check how CNCF projects prefer their naming (gRPC vs grpc vs GRPC).

There's two issues right now with textlint:
* A bug that it does not catch wrong use of terms at the end of the line (will raise an issue for that with the project)
* It works well with markdown but has issues again with hugo 

Additionally I added a cspell.json, so instead of having each and every word ignored in the file we can maintain a global set of words.

review.body: See inline comment about cSpell file.

issue.title: Page feedback shouldn't require that a Google Analytics ID be set as a config parameter

labels.name: e0-minutes
labels.description: Effort < 60 min

issue.body:
Google Analytics isn't always enabled via Docsy config -- for example, see:

- https://github.com/open-policy-agent/opa/issues/5384 and 
- https://github.com/prometheus/docs/issues/2181

For such projects, that want to use the [page-feedback feature], they should be able to `enable` page-feedback without having to supply a bogus analytics ID. WDYT @LisaFC @emckean @geriom?

[page-feedback feature]: https://www.docsy.dev/docs/adding-content/feedback/#user-feedback

comment.body: There are a number of advantages, which I hope to share here (or during the next PSC meeting I"m able to attend) soon.

issue.title: Enable Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
issue.body:
As discussed elsewhere (https://cncfservicedesk.atlassian.net/browse/CNCFSD-1458), the plan is to enable GA4 by using the existing GA4 Envoy web data stream with ID `G-DXJEH1ZRXX`.

For some context, the main repo was migrated to GA4 via:

- https://github.com/envoyproxy/envoy-website/issues/273

Let's use this issue to discuss implementation details.

Tasks:

- [x] Add GA4 ID to main site pages (that is, non-doc pages)
    https://github.com/envoy-mobile/envoy-mobile.github.io/pull/27
- [x] #2681

```

commits.message:
hive: Show actual parsed config in PrintObjects()

Before the config objects shown in PrintObjects showed the defaults by iterating
over the registered flags:

    $ ./cilium-agent objects --k8s-api-server foobar

    ⚙️ client.Config:
      • enable-k8s-api-discovery[bool]  = false
      • k8s-api-server[string]          =
      • k8s-client-burst[int]           = 0
      • k8s-client-qps[float32]         = 0
      • k8s-heartbeat-timeout[duration] = 30s
      • k8s-kubeconfig-path[string]     =

Above you can see that the "k8s-api-server" flag did not reflect what was provided on
command-line

This commit changes the config info to pull the parsed configuration from the dig
container and show that using the spew package:

    ⚙️ (client.Config) {
      K8sAPIServer: (string) (len=6) "foobar",
      K8sKubeConfigPath: (string) "",
      K8sClientQPS: (float32) 0,
      K8sClientBurst: (int) 0,
      K8sHeartbeatTimeout: (time.Duration) 30s,
      EnableK8sAPIDiscovery: (bool) false
    }

Signed-off-by: Jussi Maki <jussi@isovalent.com>

hive: Unwrap provider inputs and outputs in PrintObjects

Previously the provider function type was shown in PrintObjects:


  🚧 pkg/node.newLocalNodeStore (local_node_store.go:71): func(node.LocalNodeStoreParams) (node.LocalNodeStore, error)

This does not unwrap the param and result structs and thus does
not give enough information about the constructor. This commit fixes
the issue by using dig.FillProviderInfo to pull the constructors
actual inputs and outputs:

  🚧 pkg/node.newLocalNodeStore (local_node_store.go:71):
    ⮩ hive.Lifecycle, node.LocalNodeInitializer[optional]
    ⮨ node.LocalNodeStore

Signed-off-by: Jussi Maki <jussi@isovalent.com>

hive: Clean up breaks in PrintObjects

This removes AddBreak and does the more obvious right thing and prints the
separating newline in InfoNode.Print().

Fixes the "double breaks" after nested modules.

Signed-off-by: Jussi Maki <jussi@isovalent.com>

hive: Detect terminal width for use in InfoLeaf line wrapping

Detect the width with term.GetSize() instead of using a hard-coded width
for wrapping the list of input and output objects.

Signed-off-by: Jussi Maki <jussi@isovalent.com>

hive: Fix printing of hook function names

We need to have special handling for printing the start and stop hook
names if the hook is not the "Hook" struct.

To keep things simple just print the type name + method instead of
going via FuncForPC. This makes sure we show reasonable output for
polymorphic structs as well (which would not have file+line or the
type params if FuncForPC was used).

Log output before:
level=info msg="Start hook executed" duration="1.853µs" function="node.newLocalNodeStore.func1 (local_node_store.go:80)" subsys=hive
level=info msg="Start hook executed" duration="5.681µs" function="hive.Hook.Start-fm (<autogenerated>:1)" subsys=hive

Log output after:
level=info msg="Start hook executed" duration=992ns function="node.newLocalNodeStore.func1 (local_node_store.go:80)" subsys=hive
level=info msg="Start hook executed" duration="4.939µs" function="*resource.resource[*k8s.io/api/core/v1.Node].Start" subsys=hive

Signed-off-by: Jussi Maki <jussi@isovalent.com>

Since the builder image depends on the runtime image we should remove
the parallelization of those builds and make them sequential instead.

Signed-off-by: André Martins <andre@cilium.io>

add auto-commit capability to build base images GH workflow

This commit adds the ability to have automatic commits being pushed for
the base images github workflow. This simplifies the build process of the
base images as it will no longer require developers to wait and re-push
changes.

Resume of the changes:
- Re-write documentation with the new process
- Moved scripts to update tags in the git tree to the respective
  directories of the images. This is to prevent accidental or malicious
  changes by third-parties in the script files that could compromise the
  build process. If the files are modified, it will require an approval
  from the cilium/build team before the GH action is executed.
- Changed CODEOWNERS file to request for a review from the
  cilium/github-sec team as the scripts are directly used in the GH
  workflow.
- For future reference, this GH auto-committer workflow is using a token
  created by the machine-learning-apps/actions-app-token GH action and
  that GH action is using the auto-committer app [1] created exclusively
  for this purpose.

[1] https://github.com/organizations/cilium/settings/apps/auto-committer/permissions

Signed-off-by: André Martins <andre@cilium.io>

images: update cilium-{runtime,builder}

Signed-off-by: GH action <ghabot@does.not.exist.cilium.org>

build(deps): bump golang.org/x/crypto from 0.1.0 to 0.3.0

Bumps [golang.org/x/crypto](https://github.com/golang/crypto) from 0.1.0 to 0.3.0.
- [Release notes](https://github.com/golang/crypto/releases)
- [Commits](https://github.com/golang/crypto/compare/v0.1.0...v0.3.0)

---
updated-dependencies:
- dependency-name: golang.org/x/crypto
  dependency-type: direct:production
  update-type: version-update:semver-minor
...

Signed-off-by: dependabot[bot] <support@github.com>

k8s/client: respect QPS and burst setting for clientset

When constructing a new clientset, the provided QPS and burst values are
currently not considered.

Fixes: 00e40bb41683 ("k8s: Drop k8s.Init and k8s.Configure")

Signed-off-by: Tobias Klauser <tobias@cilium.io>

policy: replace RWMutex with Mutex

This is only locked using write locks, so replacing it with a normal
mutex would reduce the overhead by a tiny bit.

This could probably see a lot of improvements by rewriting to a proper
rwmutex and use read locking, but I think we should have some kind of
benchmark to ensure that change would be net positive; and I think
this commit is a positive step towards that.

Signed-off-by: Odin Ugedal <ougedal@palantir.com>

docs: Shuffle some conf.py variables, format pep8

Apply some pep8 styling changes, and move the language declaration above
the extlinks declaration. An upcoming commit will reuse the language
value from extlinks, so by moving it up we can avoid moving that code in
the later functional commit.

No functional changes intended in this commit.

Signed-off-by: Joe Stringer <joe@cilium.io>

docs: Remove 1.12 and earlier upgrade docs

These docs are already stored in the v1.12 branch and exposed via the
corresponding docs on docs.cilium.io, so there is no need to include
that text directly in the page. Removing it will also help developers to
update the correct notes for the upcoming release.

With a bit of conf.py trickery, we can even achieve this without
hardcoding a number that we have to update each time there's a new
release.

Signed-off-by: Joe Stringer <joe@cilium.io>

issue.title: Migrate relnotes.k8s.io to Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
issue.body:
This issue is part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4 since **Google has deprecated Universal Analytics** (UA). For more details, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to a suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Prerequisite

There is still an open discussion about which GA4 property to use. Currently the main thread is here: https://github.com/kubernetes/website/issues/37801#issuecomment-1319363201.

### Tasks

- [ ] Decide which GA4 property & measurement ID to use (see prerequisites above).
- [ ] Link UA ID from GA4 ID
- [ ] Update code to use GA4 ID:
    https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/release-notes/blob/fdfadb05eed19435097c048be21afe528eba97f4/src/index.html#L12
- [ ] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events
- [ ] Confirm that the UA site tag is still receiving events

### Notes

- Corresponding issue for main site:
  https://github.com/kubernetes/website/issues/35299

### Pre-migration website analytics info

- UA ID: `UA-98841695-4` ([analytics console](https://analytics.google.com/analytics/web/?pli=1#/report-home/a98841695w204594590p197952062))
- Website is an Angular single-page app

/cc @caniszczyk @nate-double-u @a-mccarthy

issue.body:
Hello 

I am from Minikube team and per conversation with @jimangel I am creating this issue, to request adding Google analytics to minikube website https://minikube.sigs.k8s.io/ (similar to what Kubernetes website has)

I would like to start this request and would like to know what is the next step, and do we create our own Google analytics account or share with Kubernetes Website?

comment.body:
@a-mccarthy: thanks for your response. Actually, "Example B" in the [Google Analytics 4 account structure](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9679158) page suggests a single property for all websites, and in fact, a single web stream for all websites (so that, e.g., we can configure cross-domain tracking).

For a list of k8s websites (at least those that I currently know about), see rows 2 - 12 of the [CNCF project GA4 migration status](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA). 

> You've raised questions about what sites should be connected to the Kubernetes analytics account before, and i'm note sure if there was a final answer there. 

Yes, that is the main question to be answered, and the one that will impact how we choose to setup the GA4 account. As you proposed elsewhere, maybe we should meet to discuss this.

> But this feels like something we should decide on and keep track of somewhere. Hopefully we can write down the criteria and process for getting added so folks know how to ask for this in the future.

Agreed.

issue.title: Rename Netlify preview-only host or host docs via Netlify
issue.body:
_Originally posted by @michi-covalent in https://github.com/cilium/cilium.io/issues/164#issuecomment-1315577841_

> - Docs have two hosts: I'd like some insights as to why there seem to be two hosting services active for the docs.
> 
> https://docs.cilium.io is currently using [readthedocs](https://readthedocs.org/) to host the production site. we use cncf netlify account for deploy previews. https://docs-cilium-io.netlify.app comes from that. not sure if there is a way to disable *.netlify.app domain.

The current situation is a bit confusing. Two options come to mind:

1. Consider **renaming** the Netlify preview-only **host** to contain "preview" in the name. That makes it clear that the hosting service is used for previews only (I know of at least one other CNCF project that has done this).
2. Consider actually hosting the production site and docs via Netlify. ~I seem to recall a CNCF project that had done this, but I might be confusing this with Mkdocs. I'll have to double check and get back to you.~ See next comment for details.

Thoughts @michi-covalent @lizrice @xmulligan @qmonnet

comment.body:
Not urgent. 23Q1 seems fine.

Another option would be to use Netlify snippet injection to add a banner to the preview-only site so that folks who land on it know that it is preview-only. With that in place, it might be unnecessary to rename the Netlify host.

issue.title: Migrate to Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
issue.body:
This is part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4 since **Google has deprecated Universal Analytics** (UA). For more details, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to:
  - A suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), 
  which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Tasks

- [x] Create a GA4 site tag under the **CNCF projects** account.
  The new GA4 stream measurement ID is: **`G-93T2VC0VBC`**
- [x] Main website - `UA-82811140-41`:
  - [x] [Connect] UA site tag from the GA4 site tag.
  - [x] Use [gtag.js] library to register GA4 ID - #241
  - [x] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events
  - [x] Confirm that the UA site tag, `UA-82811140-41`, is receiving events
- [ ] [docs.fluentd.org](https://docs.fluentd.org/) - `UA-181341719-4`, which CNCF doesn't currently have access to.
    https://github.com/fluent/fluentd-docs-gitbook/issues/437
  - [ ] [Connect] UA site tag from the GA4 site tag.
  - [ ] Use [gtag.js] library to register GA4 ID
- [ ] [docs.fluentbit.io](https://docs.fluentbit.io/) - `UA-181341719-3`, which CNCF doesn't currently have access to
  - [ ] [Connect] UA site tag from the GA4 site tag.
  - [ ] Use [gtag.js] library to register GA4 ID

### Later

/cc @nate-double-u @caniszczyk @fujimotos 

---

Related, background & prep-work:

issue.title: Enable Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
issue.body:
As discussed elsewhere (https://cncfservicedesk.atlassian.net/browse/CNCFSD-1458), the plan is to enable GA4 by using the existing GA4 Envoy web data stream with ID `G-DXJEH1ZRXX`.

For some context, the main repo was migrated to GA4 via:

- https://github.com/envoyproxy/envoy-website/issues/273

Let's use this issue to discuss implementation details.

issue.title: Google Analytics 4 migration followup
issue.body:
This is a followup to:

- #5382

Cleanup tasks:

- [x] [Connect] the UA ID from the GA4 data steam
- [ ] ~Replace the UA ID -- set via the `googleAnalytics` config parameter -- with a bogus ID, since Docsy (currently) requires an GA ID for the [page-feedback feature] to be enabled (in addition to the `enable = true` setting):~ 
  See @srenatus's comments below.
  https://github.com/open-policy-agent/opa/blob/73bbda334091c1365f461fe2648efae9689062c9/docs/website/config.toml#L5
  https://github.com/open-policy-agent/opa/blob/73bbda334091c1365f461fe2648efae9689062c9/docs/website/config.toml#L38-L42
- [ ] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events
- [ ] Confirm that the UA site tag is still receiving events (CNCF doesn't yet have access to this account)

Related:

- https://github.com/google/docsy/issues/1311

/cc @caniszczyk @nate-double-u @srenatus 

[page-feedback feature]: https://www.docsy.dev/docs/adding-content/feedback/#user-feedback

comment.body: @srenatus - I'm currently prioritizing the migration of other projects so that their GA4 site tags can start receiving data. I don't know if I'll be working on follow up tasks or not -- if I do, it probably wont be before 23Q3. So feel free to work on this PR when you feel the time is right :).

issue.body:
The benchmark site has a Universal Analytics (UA) property defined for it -- namely [UA-163836834-6] -- but it isn't being used.

We're in the process of migrating websites to use Google Analytics 4. For details, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108

Would you like for me to upgrade the benchmark site too? If so, I'd suggest retiring the UA site tag (since it doesn't appear to have ever been used), and activating a new GA4 tag.

If you agree, then assign this issue to me -- unless you prefer migrating to GA4 yourself.

[UA-163836834-6]: https://analytics.google.com/analytics/web/#/report/content-overview/a163836834w295210427p256310610

issue.title: Migrate to Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
issue.body:
**Google has deprecated Universal Analytics** (UA), in favor of its successor, Google Analytics 4 (GA4). This issue is part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4. For more details about the deprecation and the CNCF migration effort, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to a suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Tasks: stages 1 & 2

- [x] Create a GA4 site tag under the **CNCF projects** account.
  The new GA4 stream measurement ID is: **`G-V9SYWYG92Y`**
- [x] Enable GA4 site tag, ideally via [Netlify snippet injection] (leaving the GTM site tag in place), "Google Analytics 4 - only in production", just before `</head>`:
  ```liquid
  {% if CONTEXT == 'production' %}
  <script async src="https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtag/js?id=G-V9SYWYG92Y"></script>
  <script>
    window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];
    function gtag(){dataLayer.push(arguments);}
    gtag('js', new Date());
  
    gtag('config', 'G-V9SYWYG92Y');
  </script>
  {% endif %}
  ```
- [x] Ensure that the GA4 site tag is receiving events.
- [x] I'm going to assume that the GTM tag is still processing events, since the registration code hasn't been touched. If someone with access to that Analytics account can confirm, that would be appreciated.

### Tasks: followup

- Eventually, the GTM tag will stop working. Either it will need to be upgraded, or simply dropped in favor of the GA4 site tag. #194

### Sites

- **Main site**: this issue is for the main site, [cilium.io](https://cilium.io/), which is currently setup with a Google Tag Manager (GTM) tag, `GTM-M533ZSF`.
- **Docs**: I'll be creating a separate issue for the `docs` subdomain, which is built from [cilium/cilium](https://github.com/cilium/cilium). This docs issue is:
  https://github.com/cilium/cilium/issues/22007

/cc @caniszczyk @nate-double-u

[Netlify snippet injection]: https://docs.netlify.com/site-deploys/post-processing/snippet-injection/

comment.body:
> https://docs.cilium.io is currently using [readthedocs](https://readthedocs.org/) to host the production site. we use cncf netlify account for deploy previews. https://docs-cilium-io.netlify.app comes from that. not sure if there is a way to disable *.netlify.app domain.

I've created a separate issue to track this, see:

- #195

issue.title: Rename Netlify preview-only host or host docs via Netlify
issue.body:
hi @chalin ! 👋 

- Cilium Netlify account access: can one of you grant me access?

we are in the process of migrating https://cilium.io site from a private netlify account to cncf account. i'll let you know when the migration is complete.

- Docs have two hosts: I'd like some insights as to why there seem to be two hosting services active for the docs.

https://docs.cilium.io is currently using [readthedocs](https://readthedocs.org/) to host the production site. we use cncf netlify account for deploy previews. https://docs-cilium-io.netlify.app comes from that. not sure if there is a way to disable *.netlify.app domain.

_Originally posted by @michi-covalent in https://github.com/cilium/cilium.io/issues/164#issuecomment-1315577841_

issue.title: Post Google Analytics 4 (GA4) migration cleanup
issue.body:
Followup to:

- #164

Tasks:

- [ ] Drop GTM ID setup code: https://github.com/cilium/cilium.io/blob/dd2a0a77bd96717582c5a9a1d0f8e5294235b71e/gatsby-config.js#L142
    CNCF does't have access to the GTM account, so I'm (@chalin) unsure how you have things setup. If you've registered UA IDs, those will stop working in 2023. We can [connect] the UA ID from the GA4 web data-stream if necessary, if we want to remove the GTM ID setup code now but keep receiving events between now and their EOL.

issue.title: Add textlint tooling
issue.body:
After playing around with vale.sh for some time, I figured out that textlint might be the better tool for us, since it's config neatly fits into the package.json, so we don't need to add a huge list of additional files. Also there's some capability for "auto-fixing" which is nice if used in the visual code UI.

I still want to build this incrementally, so instead of pulling in a HUGE set of rules I wrote some terminology settings from scratch, mainly following the [CNCF style guide](https://github.com/cncf/foundation/blob/main/style-guide.md), e.g. "open-source" vs "open source" or "K8s" vs "K8S" and the suggested check how CNCF projects prefer their naming (gRPC vs grpc vs GRPC).

There's two issues right now with textlint:
* ~~A bug that it does not catch wrong use of terms at the end of the line (will raise an issue for that with the project)~~ now it works 🤷 
* It works well with markdown but has issues again with hugo 

Additionally I added a cspell.json, so instead of having each and every word ignored in the file we can maintain a global set of words.

comment.body: Yeah, I was on the fence for tabpane, but it feels ok for it to stay in the global file.

comment.body:
The string "parentbased" is not a proper spelling, but I suspect that you've added it to the list because it appears as an identifier. Is that correct?

If so, I suggest adding this word locally to the page(s) that contain the identifier. (Search for cSpell and you'll see how I've done this for other pages.

issue.title: Migrate discuss.kubernetes.io to Google Analytics 4 (GA4)

labels.name: sig/contributor-experience
labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Contributor Experience.

issue.body:
### Describe the issue

This issue is part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4 since **Google has deprecated Universal Analytics** (UA). For more details, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to a suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Tasks

- [ ] [Connect] the UA ID `UA-98841695-3` from the [GA4 web data stream `G-JPP6RFM2BP`][ga4-web]
- [x] From the [UA console], filter out all events not from `discuss.kubernetes.io`
- [ ] Configure the Discourse server to use the GA4 ID `G-JPP6RFM2BP`
- [ ] Confirm that the GA4 data stream is receiving events from the discuss server
- [ ] Confirm that the UA site tag is still receiving events

### Notes

- Corresponding issue for main site: https://github.com/kubernetes/website/issues/35299
- Followup: Drop dis[connect] the UA ID once it is no longer needed
- I'm not sure that this is the right repo to create this issue in, but it seemed like the most reasonable choice. If the issue needs to be moved, please let me know.

### Pre-migration website analytics info

- UA ID: `UA-98841695-3` ([UA console])

/cc @caniszczyk @nate-double-u

[connect]: https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9973999
[Netlify snippet injection]: https://docs.netlify.com/site-deploys/post-processing/snippet-injection/
[ga4-web]: https://analytics.google.com/analytics/web/#/p327084191
[UA console]: https://analytics.google.com/analytics/web/#/report-home/a98841695w183024907p180630334

comment.body: The old ID was `UA-98841695-3`. Of course, if you don't want analytics, that's fine. If you do want analytics, then @mrbobbytables, could you use the new ID `G-JPP6RFM2BP` where ever you removed the old ID from (assuming the gtag.js library is being used)?

comment.body: We already have a cSpell file under https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry.io/blob/main/.vscode/cspell.json. I'd suggest making additions there.

pull_request.title: Add textlint tooling
pull_request.body:
After playing around with vale.sh for some time, I figured out that textlint might be the better tool for us, since it's config neatly fits into the package.json, so we don't need to add a huge list of additional files. Also there's some capability for "auto-fixing" which is nice if used in the visual code UI.

I still want to build this incrementally, so instead of pulling in a HUGE set of rules I wrote some terminology settings from scratch, mainly following the [CNCF style guide](https://github.com/cncf/foundation/blob/main/style-guide.md), e.g. "open-source" vs "open source" or "K8s" vs "K8S" and the suggested check how CNCF projects prefer their naming (gRPC vs grpc vs GRPC).

There's two issues right now with textlint:
* A bug that it does not catch wrong use of terms at the end of the line (will raise an issue for that with the project)
* It works well with markdown but has issues again with hugo 

Additionally I added a cspell.json, so instead of having each and every word ignored in the file we can maintain a global set of words.
